news_header: India's ISRO successfully conducted its first space docking, a key step towards building an Indian space station and future lunar missions.
news_text: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) achieved a historic milestone by successfully docking two spacecraft in orbit, a crucial technology for future missions including an Indian space station and lunar exploration. The mission, named SpaDeX, launched on December 30 from Sriharikota and involved the spacecraft SDX01 (Chaser) and SDX02 (Target). After several delays, the docking was completed with precision, allowing for the transfer of power and testing inter-satellite communication. The mission also includes experiments to measure radiation and monitor Earth’s resources, while utilizing part of the rocket for further experiments in orbit.
